page.title: 08BROWNIES IN BAMFORD 1
page.content: MRS SUTTON WAS INTERVIEWED BY JEMMA WOODS AND CAROLINE HADFIELD AND PHILLIPA JONES ON THE FOURTH OF JULY 1985. THE BROWNIES MEET IN BAMFORD SCHOOL HALL EVERY MONDAY 5:30 TILL 7:00. THE BROWNIES LAW.A BROWNIE GUIDE SHOULD THINK OF OTHERS AND DO A GOOD TURN EVERY DAY.THE BROWNIES PROMISE.I PROMISE THAT I WILL DO MY BEST TO DO MY DUTY TO GOD TO SERVE THE QUEEN AND TO HELP OTHER PEOPLE AND TO KEEP THE BROWNIE GUIDE LAW.MRS SUTTON COULD NOT KEEP COUNT OF ALL THE CHARITIES WE HAVE HELPED.WE HAD RAISED SIXTY NINE POUNDS FOR ST LUKES NURSING HOME.MRS.SUTTON HAS BEEN A BROWNIE LEADER FOR ABOUT 20 YEARS NOW AND LIVES IN BAMFORD.
